isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - INSTALL

svcproc.title: HYDRO-MAX™ BOOSTER AND BACKUP PUMP ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If the backup pump was removed from the Hydro-Max™ booster, install backup pump onto Hydro-Max™ booster before installing Hydro-Max™ booster back on the vehicle. Refer to BACKUP PUMP, Install Backup Pump .

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 7) over the four threaded studs (Item 10) on the engine side of the cowl panel (Item 9) and install four flat washers (Item 6) and hex lock nuts (Item 5). Tighten to 18 to 25 lbf-ft (24 to 34 N•m).

Position the Hydro-Max™ booster pedal rod clevis (Item 3) around the brake pedal arm (Item 4) and install the retaining pin (Item 2) securing them together. Install cotter pin (Item 1) securing retaining pin.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 3 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position the master cylinder (Item 16) flange over the Hydro-Max™ booster threaded studs (Item 18). Make sure that the master cylinder outlet lines (Item 19) are not bent, kinked or damaged in any other way.

Position relay (Item 2) with relay mounting bracket (Item 17) in place over two outboard threaded studs (Item 18) and install four hex flanged nuts (Item 15) securing the master cylinder (Item 16) to the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3). Tighten to 25 to 30 lbf-ft (34 to 41 N•m).

Install the power steering outlet hose (Item 2) onto the Hydro-Max™ booster outlet port. Make sure the outlet hose is pushed all the way back onto the outlet port and that the hose clamp (Item 5) is in the proper position. Tighten hose clamp to 20 to 30 lbf-in (2.3 to 3.4 N•m).
Thread power steering fluid line hex fitting (Item 4) into Hydro-Max™ booster inlet port. Tighten to 16 to 25 lbf-ft (22 to 34 N•m).
Connect wiring harness relay connector (Item 6) into relay (Item 7).
Connect wiring harness flow switch connector (Item 8) into flow switch (Item 9).

Position backup pump power lead (Item 14) over electrical stud (Item 12) and install hex nut (Item 13). Tighten to 10 to 24 lbf-in (1.1 to 2.7 N•m). Push rubber boot (Item 10) into place to cover electrical stud, hex nut and power lead (Items 12, 13 and 14).
Once the power steering inlet line (Item 1) and outlet hose (Item 2) are connected to the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3), fill the power steering pump reservoir to the proper level.
Connect battery ground cable and unblock the vehicle wheels.

svcproc.para: Start engine. Once the engine is running, the power steering pump will circulate power steering fluid through the system. This will automatically purge air from the Hydro-Max™ booster. Press on the brake pedal several times to make sure the pedal feels normal. With the engine off, press on the brake pedal several times to make sure the pedal feels normal in the backup pump mode. Check the inlet port and outlet port connections for leakage. Retighten if necessary. Check the interface, where the backup pump attaches to the Hydro-Max™ booster for leakage. Check power steering pump reservoir level, add power steering fluid, if necessary. Road test the vehicle to make sure the vehicle stops properly.
